Tucson listens to Wheelie patiently although he had apprehensions regardin=
g his idea on how to deal with the Predicons and Decepticons.  There was al=
so the state of his temperament which indicated that he was starting to sho=
w a somewhat short fuse.  He taps his fingers on the left hand as he sits B=
ack in his chair with a bit of a hardened expression on his face. It would =
not be the first time he had lost his temper but it was clear that now was =
not the time to get Tucson Prime angry.

" Wheelie, that's enough.  When it=
 comes time for us to go into battle we will."
Now if you must speak you mu=
st first address me in an appropriate manner."

His tone of voice raises as=
 he struggles to keep his temper under control.

Perpetually on the move an=
d constantly busy. 

On Jun 28, 2011, at 11:13 PM, "adamsafran" <adamsafran=
@...> wrote:

> Wheelie resisted the urge to pick a fight over with T=
uscon at the mention of someone being injured, though the look of shooting =
his energon slugs from his slingshot up to the somewhat bulkier Autobot's o=
ptics ran strong in his optics.
> 
> Wheelie then took a seat over to the b=
ack, "Well, if they all get to have the fun, we should go catch up and get =
someone! If they won't come out to play, then we'll have to hit them anothe=
r way. In case they don't wish to come about, we'll have to go within and o=
ut! They're up to no good as it might ever seem, so I think we should take =
the chance to try and make them scream!"
> 
> > Tucson turns to Kup. He too=
, could sense something a miss.
> > 
> > " You're right Kup, something is d=
isturbing about Windlord... It seems that perhaps some Predacon programming=
 may have remained there residually.. Hopefully Stanton and Bump will be ab=
le to convince him to have another scan done of his logic circuitry, just t=
o be on the safe side. No doubt that Hydras has impacted us all, especially=
 those who have been infected by that Predacon shell program."
> > 
> > He =
tightens his fist.
> > 
> > " That is why perhaps it's wise that I confront=
 him one on one. He has not infected me but has struck at Rodimus, Windlord=
 and Nightlight. For their saftey, I take the burden of dealing with Hydras=
 personally."
> > 
> > Straight Shot, Uproar, Quickstride, and Rat Trap nea=
rly fall out of their seats with eyes wide with shock. Straight Shot is the=
 first to speak up.
> > 
> > "ARE YOU NUTS?! YOU CAN'T DO THAT HE'LL KILL Y=
OU!"
> > 
> > Quickstride chimes in next.
> > 
> > "Yeah, that's like whoah=
, seriously not a very good decision sir.. Very generous but wow, that coul=
d really be messy."
> > 
> > Rat Trap looks to Tucson.
> > 
> > "Wheels, ya=
 can't, ya just can't do that. You got a great bunch of bots, like ya said,=
 please ya gotta accept help this time."
> > 
> > Tucson looks to everyone.=

> > 
> > " I know you have all expressed concern over my actions, when it =
comes to Hydras, and I fully understand why you are so concerned. Hydras ne=
eds to be stopped, but I can not expect any of you to become vulnerable to =
his attack, when it is I who should be doing something about him personally=
. Rodimus, I owe it to you to avenge what he has done to you, Nightlight an=
d Windlord, soley due to the fact that when you needed me years ago, I did =
not come through for you. Now, I have to redeem myself for that costly mist=
ake, and amend the wrongs which have been set upon you."
> > 
> > Uproar lo=
oks to Tucson.
> > 
> > " But, that wasn't your fault. I read up on it, you=
 didn't do anything wrong, you were out there going above and beyond the ca=
ll of duty and you were unexpectedly hit from behind. There was no way you =
could have avoided what happened to you. Although, we don't know who did it=
 do we? That wasn't in the intel I read. Guys, We can't let Tucson face Hyd=
ras all alone, it's way too dangerous."
> > 
> > Straight Shot looks to Leo=
 Prime and everyone else.
> > 
> > "Leo Prime,everyone, I believe I know ho=
w ta fill in the gaps as to what happened vorns ago. I was with him during =
that battle. He had finished dealing with some of the heavy hitting battlec=
hargers, when he noticed that Rodimus and the others were getting seriously=
 pegged out in battle. He couldn't just sit there and watch it happen, and =
he knew that decoy detail wasn't best suited for his alt form which at the =
time, was more designed for utility and off road driving. But he couldn't b=
are to see anyone suffer or be oppressed so he did the unthinkable, and bey=
ond his ability specifications, he sped out there to catch the attentions o=
f the Seekers, who were concentrating on striking at the Autobot speedsters=
. Well, Tucson got their attention and began to draw them away from Rodimus=
 and the others, but then, un be known to him, way out in the distance, Cyc=
lonus hid himself nicely among cloud cover, and decided to take a pop shot =
at Tucson. Well, I saw out of the rear view, Cyclonus in the distance, and =
then I saw the shot coming toward us. After that, Tucson and I were struck,=
 but I was the only one who saw the shot and the perpetrator. Then, anythin=
g after the strike, I really don't remember."
> > 
> > Night Shift now hobb=
les into the room slowly.
> > 
> > " I do. I - was there too. I could see C=
yclonus headn' toward 'em, but I was so far off fightn' some of the combati=
cons, I couldn't get there fast enough ta swing Tucson or Straight Shot out=
a the way. I was miles behind them and no matter how loud I beeped my horn =
ta warn 'em, they couldn't hear me. Then, yeah, I saw that slag ball hit my=
 buddy, and there was an explosion that went miles up in the sky.. I though=
t for sure he was a gonner.. I did my best ta get back up, and then got Tuc=
son back ta base.. He was off line for a long time, and when he woke up, he=
 thought the power went out.. Little did he know he was struck blind by Cyc=
lonus, never ta see the light of day again, or at least until he got a seco=
nd opinion from a medic."
> > 
> > Straight Shot knew that Talon would also=
 like to see Tucson get his sight back. She smiles to Talon and puts a hand=
 on hers.
> > 
> > " I think Talon said it best, when she said it was time =
we gave Tucson back his eyes. Leo Prime, before anything else, I think it's=
 time you guys fought as a whole, and you really can't do that unless all o=
f you can see the road ahead of you. So, if I may do so, I want to request =
that Tucson Prime undergoes a detailed examination and full repair of his v=
isual impairment."
> > 
> > Tucson looks to Straight Shot and Talon.
> > 
>=
 > "They're right. It's time I stopped procrastinating. Stanton, Bump, I wo=
uld like to give you two the honor of undergoing this proceedure. I've seen=
 your work, and I would be honored if you would perform the repairs."
> > 
=
> > He looks to everyone confidently.
> > 
> > " We will do this, we will o=
vercome every obsticle they've put in front of us. But we must work as a te=
am if we're to achieve success." 
> >

irshadow Nightstar <airly2002@> wrote:

ked in sadness how Windlord Stormed out the room and then he looked at Tucs=

try to be a little more mindful of what you say. Rat Trap risked

is spark to save mine when it seemed that I was near termination. And 
> > =
> > anyone who does so, deserves respect."
> > > >

tes with a stern yet knowledgable expression on his face.
> > > 
> > > Whee=
lie just sitting over and gazing back at Tuscon, then turning over to

t to wait for Leo Prime to continue over with

<html><body bgcolor=3D"#FFFFFF"><div><br>Tucson listens to Wheelie patientl=
y although he had apprehensions regarding his idea on how to deal with the =
Predicons and Decepticons.  There was also the state of his temperamen=
t which indicated that he was starting to show a somewhat short fuse. &nbsp=
;He taps his fingers on the left hand as he sits Back in his chair with a b=
it of a hardened expression on his face. It would not be the first time he =
had lost his temper but it was clear that now was not the time to get Tucso=
n Prime angry.</div><div><br></div><div>" Wheelie, that's enough.  Whe=
n it comes time for us to go into battle we will."</div><div>Now if you mus=
t speak you must first address me in an appropriate manner."</div><div><br>=
</div><div>His tone of voice raises as he struggles to keep his temper unde=
r control.</div><div><br>Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. =
</div><div><br>On Jun 28, 2011, at 11:13 PM, "adamsafran" <<a href=3D"ma=
ilto:adamsafran@...">adamsafran@...</a>> wrote:<br><br></div=
><div><span></span></div><blockquote type=3D"cite"><div>




<span style=3D=
"display:none"> </span>



    <div id=3D"ygrp-text">
      
      
  =
    <p>Wheelie resisted the urge to pick a fight over with Tuscon at the me=
ntion of someone being injured, though the look of shooting his energon slu=
gs from his slingshot up to the somewhat bulkier Autobot's optics ran stron=
g in his optics.<br>
<br>
Wheelie then took a seat over to the back, "Well,=
 if they all get to have the fun, we should go catch up and get someone! If=
 they won't come out to play, then we'll have to hit them another way.  In =
case they don't wish to come about, we'll have to go within and out!  They'=
re up to no good as it might ever seem, so I think we should take the chanc=
e to try and make them scream!"<br>
<br>
> Tucson turns to Kup. He too, =
could sense something a miss.<br>
> <br>
> " You're right Kup, someth=
ing is disturbing about Windlord...  It seems that perhaps some Predacon pr=
ogramming may have remained there residually..  Hopefully Stanton and Bump =
will be able to convince him to have another scan done of his logic circuit=
ry, just to be on the safe side.  No doubt that Hydras has impacted us all,=
 especially those who have been infected by that Predacon shell program."<b=
r>
> <br>
> He tightens his fist.<br>
> <br>
> " That is why pe=
rhaps it's wise that I confront him one on one.  He has not infected me but=
 has struck at Rodimus, Windlord and Nightlight.  For their saftey, I take =
the burden of dealing with Hydras personally."<br>
> <br>
> Straight =
Shot, Uproar, Quickstride, and Rat Trap nearly fall out of their seats with=
 eyes wide with shock. Straight Shot is the first to speak up.<br>
> <br=
>
> "ARE YOU NUTS?!  YOU CAN'T DO THAT HE'LL KILL YOU!"<br>
> <br>
&g=
t; Quickstride chimes in next.<br>
> <br>
> "Yeah, that's like whoah,=
 seriously not a very good decision sir..  Very generous but wow, that coul=
d really be messy."<br>
> <br>
> Rat Trap looks to Tucson.<br>
> <=
br>
> "Wheels, ya can't, ya just can't do that.  You got a great bunch o=
f bots, like ya said, please ya gotta accept help this time."<br>
> <br>=

> Tucson looks to everyone.<br>
> <br>
> " I know you have all ex=
pressed concern over my actions, when it comes to Hydras, and I fully under=
stand why you are so concerned.  Hydras needs to be stopped, but I can not =
expect any of you to become vulnerable to his attack, when it is I who shou=
ld be doing something about him personally.  Rodimus, I owe it to you to av=
enge what he has done to you, Nightlight and Windlord, soley due to the fac=
t that when you needed me years ago, I did not come through for you.  Now, =
I have to redeem myself for that costly mistake, and amend the wrongs which=
 have been set upon you."<br>
> <br>
> Uproar looks to Tucson.<br>
&g=
t; <br>
> " But, that wasn't your fault.  I read up on it, you didn't do=
 anything wrong, you were out there going above and beyond the call of duty=
 and you were unexpectedly hit from behind.  There was no way you could hav=
e avoided what happened to you.  Although, we don't know who did it do we? =
 That wasn't in the intel I read.  Guys, We can't let Tucson face Hydras al=
l alone, it's way too dangerous."<br>
> <br>
> Straight Shot looks to=
 Leo Prime and everyone else.<br>
> <br>
> "Leo Prime,everyone, I bel=
ieve I know how ta fill in the gaps as to what happened vorns ago.  I was w=
ith him during that battle.  He had finished dealing with some of the heavy=
 hitting battlechargers, when he noticed that Rodimus and the others were g=
etting seriously pegged out in battle.  He couldn't just sit there and watc=
h it happen, and he knew that decoy detail wasn't best suited for his alt f=
orm which at the time, was more designed for utility and off road driving. =
 But he couldn't bare to see anyone suffer or be oppressed so he did the un=
thinkable, and beyond his ability specifications, he sped out there to catc=
h the attentions of the Seekers, who were concentrating on striking at the =
Autobot speedsters.  Well, Tucson got their attention and began to draw the=
m away from Rodimus and the others, but then, un be known to him, way out i=
n the distance, Cyclonus hid himself nicely among cloud cover, and decided =
to take a pop shot at Tucson.  Well, I saw out of the rear view, Cyclonus i=
n the distance, and then I saw the shot coming toward us.  After that, Tucs=
on and I were struck, but I was the only one who saw the shot and the perpe=
trator.  Then, anything after the strike, I really don't remember."<br>
&gt=
; <br>
> Night Shift now hobbles into the room slowly.<br>
> <br>
&gt=
; " I do.  I - was there too.  I could see Cyclonus headn' toward 'em, but =
I was so far off fightn' some of the combaticons, I couldn't get there fast=
 enough ta swing Tucson or Straight Shot outa the way.  I was miles behind =
them  and no matter how loud I beeped my horn ta warn 'em, they couldn't he=
ar me.  Then, yeah, I saw that slag ball hit my buddy, and there was an exp=
losion that went miles up in the sky.. I thought for sure he was a gonner..=
  I did my best ta get back up, and then got Tucson back ta base..  He was =
off line for a long time, and when he woke up, he thought the power went ou=
t..  Little did he know he was struck blind by Cyclonus, never ta see the l=
ight of day again, or at least until he got a second opinion from a medic."=
<br>
> <br>
> Straight Shot knew that Talon would also like to see Tu=
cson get his sight back.  She smiles to Talon and puts a hand on hers.<br>
=
> <br>
> " I think Talon said it best, when she said it was time we g=
ave Tucson back his eyes.  Leo Prime, before anything else, I think it's ti=
me you guys fought as a whole, and you really can't do that unless all of y=
ou can see the road ahead of you.  So, if I may do so, I want to request th=
at Tucson Prime undergoes a detailed examination and full repair of his vis=
ual impairment."<br>
> <br>
> Tucson looks to Straight Shot and Talon=
.<br>
> <br>
> "They're right.  It's time I stopped procrastinating. =
 Stanton, Bump, I would like to give you two the honor of undergoing this p=
roceedure.  I've seen your work, and I would be honored if you would perfor=
m the repairs."<br>
> <br>
> He looks to everyone confidently.<br>
&g=
t; <br>
> " We will do this, we will overcome every obsticle they've put=
 in front of us.  But we must work as a team if we're to achieve success." =
<br>
